item.title: Tram derails in Milan, leaving one dead and dozens injured
item.summary: The crowded tram was travelling in the centre of Milan at rush hour when it appeared to crash into the side of a building.

item.title: Pakistan defence minister says country in 'open war' with Afghanistan after strikes
item.summary: The latest attacks by Pakistan follow months of clashes between the two countries. despite agreeing to a fragile ceasefire in October.

item.title: What we know after latest escalation in Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions
item.summary: Bombings by Pakistan are the most significant development in tensions between the two neighbours - though the physical impact remains unclear.

item.title: Why Trump means the Cuban Revolution faces its biggest threat yet
item.summary: Will a worsening internal crisis create the conditions for the Cuban Revolution to unravel from within?

item.title: UK withdraws Tehran embassy staff as concern grows over threat of US strikes
item.summary: The US embassy in Israel has also told some non-emergency staff they can leave the country if they wish.

item.title: Drone jammed near French aircraft carrier was probably Russian, says Sweden
item.summary: Sweden's prime minister said it was a serious but not expected incident - and a "Russian way of acting that we recognise from other places".

item.title: Paramount set for $111bn Warner Bros takeover after Netflix drops bid
item.summary: Netflix's decision to back down from the bidding war clears the path for Paramount to win the takeover battle.

item.title: OpenAI vows safety policy changes after Tumbler Ridge shooting
item.summary: The tech firm has been criticised for not reporting the suspect's ChatGPT account to police despite it being flagged internally due to concerns over content.

item.title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
item.summary: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

item.title: Epstein tried to buy a palace in Morocco days before his arrest in 2019
item.summary: The disgraced financier was in talks to buy luxury abode Bin Ennakhi - but the purchase was never completed.
